newsitem.title: USA: Duke sees S.C. nuke at 100 pct by late week.
newsitem.headline: Duke sees S.C. nuke at 100 pct by late week.

text.p: Duke Power Co's 846 megawatt (MW) Oconee nuclear power unit 3 in Seneca, S.C., is expected to return to full power later this week after operating at a reduced level since Sunday, the company said Wednesday.
"Oconee 3 is at 62 percent to allow for repairs to an oil pump. It's expected to be back up late this week," said company spokesman Guynn Savage.
Power at the unit was reduced Sunday evening after a feedwater pump tripped off line.
Duke's 1,129 MW Catawba 1 nuclear unit in Clover, South Carolina, is expected to restart in mid-to-late September following a refueling outage, she added.
